title: Naguri's True Strength and Potential Connection to Roger's Crew
theoryText: Some fans theorize that Naguri, despite being an anime-original character, might have been much stronger in his prime than shown. His possession of Conqueror's Haki suggests he was a formidable pirate captain. There's speculation that Roger sparing him and his crew might indicate Roger saw potential in Naguri or respected his character, similar to how Roger treated other worthy opponents.
author: One Piece Fan Community
evidenceFor: Naguri possesses Conqueror's Haki, a rare ability only seen in powerful individuals
Roger spared his life despite defeating him, showing respect
Roger's pattern of showing mercy to worthy opponents
evidenceAgainst: Naguri is anime-original and not canon to the manga
The episode shows Naguri was 'easily defeated' by Roger
No further mention or appearance of Naguri in later episodes

title: The Significance of Luffy Learning About Ace's Father at This Moment
theoryText: Fans have discussed why the anime chose to show this specific moment of Sabo revealing Ace's parentage to Luffy, which wasn't explicitly shown in the manga. Some theorize this was done to emphasize Luffy's unconditional acceptance of Ace regardless of his heritage, foreshadowing Luffy's later reactions during the Marineford War. The theory suggests this scene was added to strengthen the emotional impact of Ace's death and Luffy's determination.
author: One Piece Anime Viewers
evidenceFor: The scene strengthens the emotional connection between Luffy and Ace
It explains how Luffy knew about Ace's father without shock during Marineford
The anime often adds scenes to enhance emotional impact
evidenceAgainst: This contradicts the manga where Luffy's knowledge of Ace's parentage is ambiguous
Could be seen as unnecessary filler content

title: Naguri's Conqueror's Haki as Foreshadowing for Luffy
theoryText: Some fans believe that Naguri's display of Conqueror's Haki in front of young Luffy was intentional foreshadowing by the anime team. Even though Luffy didn't understand what he was seeing, this early exposure to Conqueror's Haki might have planted a seed that would later manifest when Luffy awakened his own Conqueror's Haki. The theory suggests this was the anime's way of showing that Luffy had been exposed to this power long before he used it himself.
author: One Piece Theory Community
evidenceFor: Luffy witnesses Conqueror's Haki at a young age
The anime often adds foreshadowing elements
Luffy later awakens Conqueror's Haki at Amazon Lily (Episode 389)
evidenceAgainst: Naguri is not canon to the manga
Luffy shows no recognition or understanding of the power
Conqueror's Haki is stated to be innate, not learned through exposure
